website_summaries.verdict: This military-style cot comes in several colors and is very comfortable.
pros: Cot comes in several color options
Easy to get out and set up
Eliminates the middle bar, which can sometimes make cot sleeping uncomfortable
cons: Not as compact for storage as others on the market
Has some problems with frame strength
72-inch length may not work for taller individuals

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Made well
customer_reviews.text: I sleep in this every night in the public park after my wife kicked me out. It's super comfy & cleans easy.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy - LOW QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: ***** UPDATE ***** 7-1-19 This cot truly is exceptional to sleep on. HOWEVER! I’ve used it ONLY 10 times and on my last camping trip, it tore in the middle. The seller “Magshion” will not replace the cot with another one. Super disappointed. BEWARE OF SELLER, they obviously don’t stand behind they’re products. ***** First post ***** I’ll never sleep on the ground while camping again! Love this cot!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan N.

customer_reviews.title: Beware of the cover.
customer_reviews.text: The cot itself is sturdy enough for the cost, and I'm glad of the purchase. The cover is cheap and flimsy and doesn't even cover the cot which makes it useless. The image of the cover is misleading. Please know that you will need to find a different cover if you want to protect this cot during storage. I cannot use the box as storage because it was crushed during delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and stable.
customer_reviews.text: I've slept on the ground for so many years that this cot really made me unhappy when I realized how big it was. It doesn't roll up, just folds in the middle so it's a big rectangular package. However, when I slept on it all was forgiven. Not just the luxury of not sleeping on a pad on the ground, but the canvas doesn't cave in the middle, and the hype about not being able to feel the middle support is accurate. What a treat!
customer_reviews.author: Emily L. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: For the price it is a good product. I am 270 # and I can ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price it is a good product. I am 270 # and I can rest comfortably on it, though I'm not sure I would trust it as a long term solution. It seems sturdy enough, but has a few plastic parts that I see as fail points. Also, at 6' 2" I don't exactly have room for stretching out. It is perfect for my kids though, which I why I bought it. When they have friends over, or we go stay in a motel and need an extra bed (not super keen on some of the motel spare beds) it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: J.A.

customer_reviews.title: Great price for the quality you're getting
customer_reviews.text: Great price for the quality you're getting. Shockingly easy to set up, and it folds up super compact for storage! Don't waste your time or money with airbeds anymore. Just get a nice cot (and maybe a foam topper), and that's that! Note: if you're taller than 5'-11" (1.8m) you will not be able to stretch out without your feet going over the end. Still, you won't be too uncomfortable, I believe. It's also not very wide, so turning over in the night will take a little bit of care. Other than that, it's totally fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made and affordable!
customer_reviews.text: This cot is one of the best made designs I have found. It is inexpensive and collapses to a nice compact size. The legs swing out from underneath and click into a locked position supported through the main frame. This helps stabilize the bed and prevents it from collapsing if kids play on it. It is very portable and the bedding material is securely sewn into and around the frame. The camouflage pattern is a big hit with my 8 year old son who finds it very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Eliz

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Sturdy & Stable
customer_reviews.text: We got it for camping and it is comfortable, sturdy and stable for my son to sleep on in our tent. He also likes to use it at home. He's slept consecutive days on this cot with no issues. I bought a COT for myself that was highly rated, $20 more than his, and compactly folds up to the size of folding chair. Packing wise mine is easier to stack in the trunk. If I had to do over again, I would have purchased 3 of the "Magshion Portable Military Fold Up Camping Bed COTs" even though it would take up more room.
customer_reviews.author: TRL

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow
customer_reviews.text: I never want to be that person who gives a bad review but..... Lightweight and easy set up - for sure. But, very uncomfortable. When your kids say sleeping on the ground with a thermarest is more comfortable then you know you have a problem. I think the issue is they are a bit narrow. I am not a huge person (and my kids certainly aren't either), but these cots are just too narrow and a bit short to be very comfortable. I wish I could return these. I will likely end up giving them away and getting larger ones. Live and learn I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend these to anyone
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these because my children have broken every bed they've ever had, and it was becoming expensive. I figured if they break these, it would be cheap to replace. So far they've lasted longer than any regular bed they've ever had. Even with them propping them up in the windowsill and using the cots as a slide. They've never even bent. I would recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to use car camping
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for car camping ...NO more waking up on the floor of a wet tent! Im 5'2" and 112 lbs so this works for me. It is super easy to use just pop it open and you are done. You can feel the support bars a bit during the night which was a little bit uncomfortable so Im not sure how someone much larger would fare comfort wise. Im going to get a camp cushion that should eliminate the bar issue. Ive only used it once but so far but i love it !
customer_reviews.author: Laur

customer_reviews.title: Disabled thumbs up! 👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: Sooo glad I found this! Such a great value! I had been looking for an old school folding lounge to lay out in the sun, and couldn’t find a well made one under 70.00! Then, I stumbled onto this and I’m so glad I did! So well made! And lightweight! I am disabled, and can unfold/set up/fold back up/and carry with no assistance! Woohoo! What a great purchase! So pleased!
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: 105 lb daughter was to heavy for stitching
customer_reviews.text: was used by my 105 lb. daughter 3 times and the stitched seam along one side ripped out (it looks like it was sewn too close to the edge of the material). Seemed like a decent cot, but wouldn't even stand up to my slender daughter using it. Of course it ripped out a month ago, but my daughter didn't tell me until today, 13 days after the return window closed!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Lee

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to use as a tanning chair
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't find any of the cheap gummy-strap folding lounge chairs anywhere this summer, so I tried this as a chair to lay out in. It is sturdy and comfortable. I am a larger person, and I don't think I would be comfortable sleeping on it because of it's width. But it seems like it would be good for a smaller person or child to sleep on.
customer_reviews.author: twilli

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I received this item today and it had some damage due to the outside box being penetrated. It had some damage to the tube on the middle of one side of the cot. It was still usable so I am not returning it, they were kind enough to issue me a credit and I am going to use it. The boxes used to ship in need to be more sturdy. The storage bag that comes with it is little more than a dust cover, so dont think it will hold up for anything more than that. Over all, I am pleased with the product and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Nannie

customer_reviews.title: FITS IN A 6' TRUCK BED
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a cot that will fit in the back of my pick up, and finally found it. This will fit in a 6' truck bed with the tailgate shut. There is also plenty of room under the cot to stow away gear while you sleep. The center bar is shaped like the letter H, so it is well below your back and out of the way. I found the cot to be comfortable, and it sets up & takes down really fast (15 sec.)
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: very nice
customer_reviews.text: Use in my vehicle as I travel around the country have had more expensive cots that broke or tore this one is so far holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable cot for a small adult or a kid for camping.
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my 8-year-old when camping along with a twin foam cut down to size. About 4 of these would fit in an 8 person tent. She did bang her knee against the metal sides so a bit more fabric coverage on the metal sides would be great. Would definitely recommend a cot over air mattresses as everyone else in the camping group air mattress went flat after one night.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rowley

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: This cot is about 5 pounds, very light. I know it says 10 pounds in the description but the label on the UPS box says 5 pounds. My son and husband both slept on it and says it is very comfy w/o having to use a sleeping mat. Easy to store gear under the cot. This is not a backpacking cot as it folds in half and no way to attach to a back pack. The bag to store it in also doesn’t seal around the cot we just sewed on a Velcro strip for transporting it and keep it stored in its original shipping box.
customer_reviews.author: cinteza

customer_reviews.title: This cot is well worth the money, good quality, and comfy.
customer_reviews.text: This is worth every dollar spent on this cot. It is made of very high durable material and is high quality made. I got this for my 6 year old Grandaughter. She loves it. This cot sits as high as a normal bed and will fit a tall adult with plenty of room left over. It's very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Marie

customer_reviews.title: ... a cot that had enough room under it to easily store gear(bed for mini van)
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a cot that had enough room under it to easily store gear(bed for mini van) , was comfy, no middle support bar sticking into my back, and was taut. After reading the reviews/specs on so many cots, this was the one I choose as it seemed to meet all my criteria. I couldnt be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: p.limb

customer_reviews.title: great camp cot for a reasonable price!!
customer_reviews.text: even after reading the reviews on this I decided to give it a try. I was pleasantly surprised. It's very sturdy, easy to put together and seems durable. I bought it for my kids to use for trips to grandma's and for camping. I think this will work perfect for that. The kids were happy and said it was comfy to lay on and were happy it was so BIG for them. I laid on it and it seems comfy enough. I may end up getting one for me too!!
customer_reviews.author: L. Boots

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the overworked bachelor
customer_reviews.text: As a Baptist preacher, we can at best squeeze 25 hours out of a 24-hour day. This cot is simply perfect and pretty comfortable as I just stick it in the office whenever I need to sleep at the church. As you can see from the picture, it slides in snugly between the 4' minifridge and bookcase. I don't think it would make a great travel cot simply because the cover is a real thin cover that doesn't completely cover the cot nor protect it. I should also mention that I'm about 5'8". If you're over 6', your feet are going to dangle over the edge unless you have a pillow to cover the top bar
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Wanna sleep outside?
customer_reviews.text: Thank you from the bottom of my heart for saving my 41 year old back from enduring another camping season sharing an air mattress with a toddler. When you only weigh 20lbs, you get all the air and I get all the ground. I got this one for the price, and the fact that no bar would be poking me in the back while I slept. I just did 2 nights on our maiden voyage, and with these I think I can delay that pop-up camper purchase for at least 2 more seasons. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Xanabart Fagan

customer_reviews.title: and that helps with the cool nights.
customer_reviews.text: For work (as a wildlife biologist) I car camp regularly. I decided to switch from sleeping on a groundcloth with an air pad to cot and bivy sack. This has significantly improved my sleep. I do not feel the bar. I made my own cover to keep it clean in travel (dusty forest service roads and it's in the bed of my work truck). No problems. I did buy a closed-cell foam pad, and that helps with the cool nights.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Rex

customer_reviews.title: Good Cot
customer_reviews.text: Good cot, not great. Its very comfortable to lay in but it's a bit narrow. My arms kept flopping off the sides and it was quite uncomfortable (just for the arms, everything else was fine). If you're a side sleeper you wont have any problems. If you lay flat on your back and you don't have narrow shoulders you'll need a sleeping bag or something to keep your arms from falling off the sides. Definitely inconvenient but not a dealbreaker. I'd still reccomend this cot because of how easily it folds, how light it is to carry, and how dang good it looks.
customer_reviews.author: Jade W

customer_reviews.title: Great for Camping with Kids
customer_reviews.text: We used a couple of these for tent camping for our 11 and 9-year old. They worked great. The kids love them and find them very comfortable. We just put their sleeping bags on top and they passed out. I like it because it's fairly lightweight, easy to set up and looks durable. Not only was it comfortable but it really helped because the temperature dropped at night. It would have been difficult for us to sleep on the cold ground, even with an camping mat. They are fairly wide, however, so be sure to check your tent dimensions. They also come fully assembled, which is helpful.
customer_reviews.author: TA

customer_reviews.title: Didn't come with a storage bag. And is bad for people with a bad back.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good item if you don't have back problems. If you do i recommend getting an air mattress to go on top of it. It didn't come with a storage bag as it said in the description but I don't need one anyways. I bought two of these, one for my wife and I. I used them for the first time last month and my back was killing me. I've since bought air mattresses and they work great now. Keeps you off the ground in the tent at least.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Smith

customer_reviews.title: It is comfortable
customer_reviews.text: After wasting so much money on air mattress's that do not hold up, I decided to buy a cot instead. I am so glad I did. Well made and sturdy and so far it is great. My son sleeps on it when he is home and he loves it. My daughter also wants one now, she was impressed with how comfortable it was.
customer_reviews.author: angel

customer_reviews.title: Solid inexpensive cot!
customer_reviews.text: This cot is quite comfortable with a 2 inch foam pad. If you intend to camp out for more than a day or two, it is vastly superior to sleeping on the ground or on a pad on the ground. It felt solid and sturdy and was long enough for my 5'11" height. I suspect that the weak link over time will be the plastic components, but it should last a good long time if it is taken care of. For the price, I can't imagine you will find a better product!
customer_reviews.author: Havana Harry

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cot. It has served me well on my rotating shifts and as an extra bed (I moved for a short-term assignment, but did not want to call movers, so I used this in lieu of an actual bed). Quality is good and the cot is holding up well after months of use. However, the carrying “bag” is useless (it is a flimsy fabric with no closure or handle for carrying—it made more sense to discard the bag and just carry the cot itself.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Chan

customer_reviews.title: First night, so far so good
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up, very solid feel, and no squeaks!! It’s still a cot, but the most comfortable one I’ve ever used. As long as the stitching holds up, this should last us a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Natroneous

customer_reviews.title: Missing screws ☹️......overall a great product....and amazon took care of me😊
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a sturdy comfortable cot for the money. It is easy to unfold and easy to store. We bought these for our 4 grandchildren and they loved them. The only issue was that one of them was missing the screws so we couldn’t use it. I called amazon to see if they could have the company send out the screws and all they could do was give me the number and send a return label. They were quick to do what they could. I called the company and they wouldn’t send the screws so we had to return to amazon.
customer_reviews.author: CLCook

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth buying, just not for adults
customer_reviews.text: Well I purchased them for the grand kids to use on a upcoming visit..however I bent one when I tried to lay on it just to take a picture. It does not close as compact as it did before..i am not 300 pounds...and really do not think it should have bent. It did not break and for what I need it for I will keep it..,I just will not try to lay on one again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Helpful, but not very durable - kid use only
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product twice for guests with acceptable reviews from both of them however when my I attempted to use the cot on a camping trip the metal rods on the side bent and could not be straightened. I ended up trying to sleep on the hard floor of my tent. I am hoping to contact the seller for a replacement. If I receive a favorable response, I will update this review. No reply from seller as of 2020.
customer_reviews.author: Gulfport Girl

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable and legs bent
customer_reviews.text: Used this cot in a spare bedroom and it was terribly uncomfortable AND the legs bent inwards under weight. This might work for someone who weighs under 100 pounds but it buckled under 210 pounds. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DagDerNiT

customer_reviews.title: I threw in a 4" millard full-sized mattress on top and it felt like sleep for the kinds
customer_reviews.text: Placed two of these in a 2016 Toyota Sienna LE in the backside, fits perfectly and thus, mini camper van created. I threw in a 4" millard full-sized mattress on top and it felt like sleep for the kinds.
customer_reviews.author: jenny

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money works great!
customer_reviews.text: I am highly impressed with these cots! We bought two for a camping trip in the mountains of Virginia in October. We’ve also used them for guests when we are out of space in the rooms. Very durable and very strong. I’m almost 6 ft tall and it was long enough for me to lay on it without my feet going off of it. While camping we added blankets as the “mattress” and it was extremely comfortable! Well worth the cost!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Bent frame.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this cot and use it for a weekend camp out. It was comfortable and roomy. However, when it came time to pack it up at the end of the weekend, I noticed the frame was bent. I was really disappointed. I am over 50 pounds lighter than the heaviest weight recommended. I sent it back for a refund. No problem in getting a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Don Moore

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy for now
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a decent product for the money. Dont recommend falling into this thing. Need to easy into it. No bars in the back which is good...but the flimsy nylon bag it come in is starting to tear. No handles on the thing either so 2 hands to carry unless ur over 6'5 and u can carry under ur arm
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: POOR QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: ripped at seam when only 2 months old. Used only 3-4 times. Most weight was 165 lbs. Sent message to seller, amazon site says 2 reply. Its been a week and a half, no reply. Cant return after 30 days, and they won't reply to even attempt to make it right. Don't buy from this seller and don't buy this item!!
customer_reviews.author: LJD

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than a deck chair, works just as well
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to use as a deck lounger get because it was cheaper and had less moving parts to worry about breaking/failing. I've only used it for two pool days, but I love it so far. The legs can be pretty springy when you open it, and I pinched my fingers the first time- a cuss filled lesson learned. It's surprisingly comfortable. I've fallen asleep both times I've used it. Will post an update if my opinion changes..
customer_reviews.author: Theresa S.

customer_reviews.title: Not very strong
customer_reviews.text: The fourth time I slept on the cot the bars bent. I will not sleep on it now for fear I will end up on the floor or something might snap and stick me. It was hard to fall asleep because it was not comfortable so I woke up to switch positions every couple hours all night long. Now that the frame is bent it will not fold properly and I can't use the case it came with. The cot is pretty much garbage now! Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Alison Pacut

customer_reviews.title: ... our cots this weekend for camping and we're very pleased. The fabric is nicely taut so we didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: We used our cots this weekend for camping and we're very pleased. The fabric is nicely taut so we didn't feel like we were sinking and didn't feel the middle crossbar. The supports were very steady so we didn't feel like we were about to tip over. We're happy campers (pun intended)!
customer_reviews.author: Dale Borja

customer_reviews.title: Nice, seems like good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Yet to try it out but just pressing my hands on it or sitting on it (170 lbs), not so sure it would last long with a person over 200 lbs. But it seems to be nice quality. Would be nicer if I had the cushions I ordered to go with it so I could sleep on it one night and test it. The cushions (different company) never shipped...out of stock!
customer_reviews.author: Sharlene Plescia

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Great for car camping, used to make fun of folks that used cots... but now I am older and enjoy the ease of putting on my boots in the morning as well as the less back pain of sleeping on a good surface. I use this with my normal backpacking pads for a great nigh's rest.
customer_reviews.author: Leo A millan

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these for our kids (8 and 10) to sleep on during a trip. They say they're very comfortable and love sleeping on them. The are easy to set up and take down within seconds. I'm thrilled with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MR29

customer_reviews.title: Must be on level ground!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the money but where I used this at the campsite the ground was uneven and I ended up not having it perfectly level (dodnt haveva choice) and it ended up bending and being hard to fold and when I tried laying on my back it was overextended and very uncomfortable... Thought for it being able to hold 300 pounds it would be a bit more sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Lissa T

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Went camping and it was too big for my 2person tent. I used it anyway. Sturdy....stiff...easy to unfold and fold
customer_reviews.author: dBarlow

customer_reviews.title: Great light weight cot
customer_reviews.text: This cot is very light weight. It has a thin cover for storage. I am using it for when we have guest children stay at our house. It's easy to set up and take down.
customer_reviews.author: Gingko

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for when Grandson Spends the Night
customer_reviews.text: My four year old grandson loves this camping bed when he spends the night with us, and when he goes home we fold it up, put it back in its cool bag and stick it in the closet. It works great for us and he can certainly grow a few feet and still fit on it.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Baker

customer_reviews.title: Cot
customer_reviews.text: Order didn’t arrive at my house like tracking said, contact seller they responded immediately and sent me a new one. The cot looks to be well constructed, not a overpriced kids cot, looks like a average adult can sleep on it and be good, We have had it a few months with light use and it held up .
customer_reviews.author: Mj

customer_reviews.title: Tore first time it was used. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: We order all of our camping equipment through Amazon and are almost always happy with the purchases. However, this time we are SO disappointed. I bought it in Nov as a Christmas gift for my grandson. He used it for the first time this spring to camp. Imagine how disappointed we were when it came I sewed and tore the first night it was used. And now I'm told the time to return it has passed. Not Good.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Exley

customer_reviews.title: great as a sun lounge chair
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't find a lounge chair anywhere and then I found this and it's perfect. It's sturdy and quite light weight. It's bigger then your average lounge chair but honestly that's just a bonus in my opinion. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Z

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3 of these cots to keep at my house for my niece's and nephew to sleep on when they stay over. I was skeptical when I first made the purchase because the price was so much less than other sellers. But when I received then they were shipped nicely and they were great quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: J Mac

customer_reviews.title: Cot
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter because she sleeps outside when we camp and she loves it it’s comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Good solid cot for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good solid cot. Folds well and is lightweight. Reminds me of a cot I had as a kid that lasted for over 10 years. I expect this one to perform just the same. The best part is that it is an extremely affordable product for the quality
customer_reviews.author: D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: It's okay~~
customer_reviews.text: Some sharp edges from welding residue. Could have been dangerous if I hadn't discovered it in advance. Plastic pieces/feet easily falls off. But usable overall. Didn't expect too much.. price on par with Wallymart...
customer_reviews.author: Digiko

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy even for a large size adult
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy even for a large size adult. Is pretty bulky when folded. The black bag is terrible quality. It's like a reusable shopping bag but even cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: For the price - it's great to know we'll get a few years use out ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our son's scout trips and camping. While it's a little cumbersome vs the roll up models, we don't have to worry about him having to stretch it over the bars at every set up - and risk ripping the fabric. For the price - it's great to know we'll get a few years use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would like these. I put trifold memory foam on it. It just didnt work out. Maybe for a kid just not comfortable. I wish I went camping prior to the return date. Now I am stuck with them.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: So much better than having to replace inflatable mattresses every year or more. Very compact, light, well made, expands easily. very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: aaabbbccc

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This saved me when I went camping. I had back surgery about a year ago and knew I couldn't sleep on the ground. It's easy to fold and unfold. It was comfortable and I had no problem sleeping at all.
customer_reviews.author: LORI R WHITE

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old slept on this for 3 weeks while visiting family. He loved it. Found it very comfortable and it’s light weight. We took it to 3 different houses and transport was very easy.
customer_reviews.author: melli

customer_reviews.title: Boys love them!
customer_reviews.text: My boys love anything military. This cot is wonderful. Very sturdy and easy for my small 9 year old to carry. He wants to spend the night at grandmas so he can take his cot. We had to make him put it away because he wants to sleep on it every night.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for camping or vacations.
customer_reviews.text: 10 yo used on vacation and love it. I bought it ahead of time and had it mailed to my stepdads house. It folds in the middle and comes with a cheap bag to store it in. Getting more for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey M. O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: Not the right one. Trust me.
customer_reviews.text: Super uncomfortable. And very noisy when you move. Better off sleeping on the floor!
customer_reviews.author: Robin L.

customer_reviews.title: NICE
customer_reviews.text: This one came pre-assembled, so I just took it out of the package ready to use. I would say the storage bag is useless as it is made out of cheap landscape cloth. For my application, extra sleep area for campers in the garden cottage, it is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Beverly S.

customer_reviews.title: Van Life Must Have, great price, lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: Love this cot!! Its perfect for my Van life. I just placed my 8 inch foam matress on top of it and wahla I have a bed without having to build it and this cot is lightweight. The price is right! I looked around and it was the best price. Also, great you can store things under it, perfect for Van life! Get the green one because its the best price and its a fine color.
customer_reviews.author: vivian robinson

customer_reviews.title: Made cheap cot.
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made. And doesnt hold up tonhalf the weight it says it does. Bought this for my daughter for her missions trip. One end is bowed just from sitting on it and where the two ends meet in the middle the tubing has bent as well. Do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Reaves

customer_reviews.title: Frame bent before we even slept on it
customer_reviews.text: The frame bent when my 130 pound daughter sat on it. It creased in half, toppled her to the ground and we had to bend it back together and wrap it with duct tape and a tent stake to get through the campout.
customer_reviews.author: Uno

customer_reviews.title: Study, portable.
customer_reviews.text: Great for extra bed at home. I use them for grandkids sleepovers, they love them. Strong enough for adults too. I also use them in yard, in summer as an extra flat lounger and seating.
customer_reviews.author: Irene Deiston

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up and take down. Narrow enough to store easily in an over crowded closet!
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally write reviews, I expect the product to be as described. However, this cot exeeds my expectations. I purchased this cot to support my Einstein slant, so that I didn't have to use the slant on the floor. I am a "sizeable" person 😁, so I really depended on the reviews stating that the cot had good support. Not only can I depend on the support of the cot when I stand up, but there is no creaking when I lay down.
customer_reviews.author: Lari

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, easy to set up. Does not fold lengthwise if that is a problem.
customer_reviews.text: Rather comfortable, and very easy to set up. One thing to keep in mind, is that it does not fold up lengthwise like some camp cots do. This makes it a bit awkward to carry, but it stores easily enough in a hallway closet until you need it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grandson Loves it
customer_reviews.text: He has made it his own lil private area to do his computer games and homework, he falls asleep right on it and thats great because I don’t want him in the floor, I just love this cot
customer_reviews.author: Joyce White

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold up to weight specifications
customer_reviews.text: 4 and 6 year old children slept on these cots approximately 8 times. Seam has already ripped and company will not stand by product for a replacement. Weight capacity specifies 300 lbs. This is highly questionable as it would not hold a 40 lb. child.
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: Great Cot & Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cot! I just bought my third one. They are light, easy to fold, and are sturdy. My grandchildren love them for sleepovers. They are great for camping, too!
customer_reviews.author: Carol 1455

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy to fold up and fold out
customer_reviews.text: This cot is sturdy, easy peasy to fold up and fold out and not heavy. I wish the cover that the case slides in would be better, but overall the cot can hold an adult with no problem at all and very comfortable for being so affordable. Worth the buy!
customer_reviews.author: Aalicia_85

customer_reviews.title: Glad I purchased this.
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It's very comfortable and easy to move and fold. I highly recommend this item for someone who needs a temporary bed and it doesn't take up much storage space.
customer_reviews.author: M. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, Comfortable & Easy to Manage
customer_reviews.text: We got this cot for a guest to sleep on over Christmas. It was sturdy, comfortable, didn't squeak - and was easy to fold/unfold. I highly recommend this ... everything you need in a cot - and the camouflage pattern is really cool too.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: Not made for a heavy child.
customer_reviews.text: I liked that it stayed with us for about a week until it decided to break on us. I bought this for the use of having my son over so he can stay the night. But after a week it no longer hold it form. The center bar couldn’t hold on any longer.
customer_reviews.author: JYP

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this just junk!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute junk it collapsed the first time I tried to take a nap in it and I am nowhere near 300lbs!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sean Spangler, CTPO

customer_reviews.title: works very well.
customer_reviews.text: Took on Vacation. The middle does not stay down at first. Though after a couple days it lays flat. I think it is a good value for the money & takes up little space. Our son is 11 had no problems at all w/ it. the middle goes back down once you lay on it. Folds up easily. No assembly required. That is a huge plus.
customer_reviews.author: DL T.

customer_reviews.title: A perfect solution for overnight guests and comfy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a 750 ft studio. I am having people come to stay with me for the holidays. They are going to be so yummy to lay, however, I ordered 2 and only one came with the black cover. I would love to have the other one sent to me because they can sit in plain sight and noone will know what they are. Thank you. Update: I FOUND IT!!!! THE cover for the other bed cot was inside the fold. YIPPY!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: sooki gordy

customer_reviews.title: Well...
customer_reviews.text: This could have been much sturdier. After only a little after a month, the cot completely bent beyond repair. Didn't realize you couldn't just sit on it without the side bars bending down to the ground and breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Wallace

customer_reviews.title: I am pleased by things arriving as advertised and when expected.
customer_reviews.text: I like how sturdy and easy to use this is. It supports without being wobbly or threatening to collapse. It's good and arrived fairly promptly, too unlike the other one I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect cot for camping or an extra bed for an overnight guest. It’s very comfortable & easy to fold out or back in for storage under the bed or in the hallway closet.
customer_reviews.author: H. Craig

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Lightweight Good Price.. WRONG color sent Frustrating
customer_reviews.text: I gave it overall 3 stars because I was sent the color blue instead of green. I needed to use it right away with no time to return plus when I looked at the sellers cots again, there was NO Green to choose. It’s very sturdy and lightweight which is what I was looking for. not very comfortable but if you put a air mattress or some thick bedding under you it’s much better.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Bailey

customer_reviews.title: DONT WAIST YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Dont buy such a waist of money. My 90 lb son sleep on it the first night and one of the metal bars bent and it clams it holds up to 300 lb
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Not quiet as we had hoped
customer_reviews.text: One of the reasons we purchased this particular bran of camping bed was based on other reviews that stated how quiet the bed is. Well, not so -- sitting on the bed, turning on the bed, makes a lot of noise; it's difficult to pinpoint the source, but I believe the noise occurs where the material of the bed meets the frame. Anyhow, if there are light sleepers in the room where this bed is being used, it will indeed wake them up. Otherwise, the bed appears to be sturdy, well made.
customer_reviews.author: M. Halpern

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, love it! Thank you! Exactly what I expected and it is very long (good for my dad because he is well over 6 ft)
customer_reviews.author: Bluegrass14

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This cot is easy to store and set up. It's nice and taut, which is how I like a mattress. I put a camping pad (Thermarest) on it and it's almost as comfy as my real bed. An exceptional value.
customer_reviews.author: McKenna Linn

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Got this a cot for my kids when they need to sleep in our room. We are also using this on our camping trips this summer.
customer_reviews.author: BAM

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought four of these thinking that they would be broke in a week because of my destructive children and I have now had them for over a month. That is amazing to me.
customer_reviews.author: Rainesnair

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good camp cot. A little bulky to travel with. Comfort is ok. Plastic feet pop off and get lost. Serves its purpose. Even used for guests at house occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: farmfletch

customer_reviews.title: Quick fold up for more room space
customer_reviews.text: Bought it fir my sin as an extra fir when he comes to stay with me. He says he slept well on it. I put a mattress in top for more comfort and it held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen

customer_reviews.title: Best cot I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: Very surprisingly comfortable bought a twin size memory foam topper cut it to fit this got the army military print very cool and my kid approves as the extra bed for sleepover guests just chilling
customer_reviews.author: Quasimotos Bride

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels well made.
customer_reviews.text: Looks and feels well made. It is comfortable to lay on. Could use some type of little pad to cover the center hinge (we covered it with a quilt) to keep from scraping your skin. Made as well as the ones my daughter bought at Cabela's for $89
customer_reviews.author: J. D.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this product came in bent on the frame. Not a little dent or bend a huge one. This effected the performance of the product and because of the dent after two nights of sleeping the cot collapsed on my nine year old. Not cool at all
customer_reviews.author: Linda Yates

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my temporary situation. Have been aleeping on it for 3 mos now, i added foam padding. Not bad. Very sturdy. Ive had no issues. 4'11" female, 170lbs
customer_reviews.author: JD

product_meta.title: Magshion Portable Military Fold Up Camping Bed Cot + Free Storage Bag- 7 Colors
feature_bullets: Great - for adults, children, campers and also explorers
DESIGN - Portable cot with a quick and easy fold up design(included Storage Bag)
Size: 13. 5"H x 24. 5"W x 72"L (Fits Heights 6" Tall Max)
U-shaped legs distribute weight to minimize the possibility of damaging a tent floor

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
